meanings.definition: To raise or tilt (a road or railway track) at the outer edge in order to facilitate faster travel around a curve.
meanings.sent1: The engineers had to superelevate the road to make it safer for drivers going around the sharp bend.
meanings.sent2: The workers will superelevate the railway track to ensure the train can navigate the turn smoothly.
meanings.sent3: Why did the road decide to superelevate itself? To give cars a thrilling ride around the corner!
meanings.sent4: Her spirits seemed to superelevate as she turned the curve of life's challenges with grace.
meanings.sent5: The decision to superelevate the track was like giving the train a boost around the bend.

meanings.definition: To elevate or raise to a higher level or position.
meanings.sent1: The teacher's praise can superelevate a student's confidence in their abilities.
meanings.sent2: She hoped her hard work would superelevate her status within the company.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to superelevate its toy mouse to the top of the bookshelf.
meanings.sent4: His kindness seemed to superelevate him in the eyes of his peers.
meanings.sent5: The promotion would superelevate her career to new heights.
